intro: Triplasandra oahuensis, commonly known as the Oʻahu triplasandra, is a rare endemic plant native to the island of Oʻahu in Hawaii. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small white flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species from threats such as habitat loss and invasive species.
